meanings.definition: A boy who assists in making copies, typically in a newspaper office.
meanings.sent1: The copyboy quickly ran to the printer to get more copies for the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The newspaper office hired a new copyboy to help with the daily tasks.
meanings.sent3: The copyboy accidentally made copies of the wrong article, causing a small mix-up.
meanings.sent4: In the busy newsroom, the copyboy was like a copy machine himself, constantly duplicating tasks.
meanings.sent5: The young copyboy's job was to ensure every article had enough copies for distribution.

meanings.definition: A young male employee responsible for running errands and performing various tasks in an office setting.
meanings.sent1: The copyboy delivered important documents to different departments throughout the day.
meanings.sent2: In the office, the copyboy was always ready to assist with any task that needed to be done.
meanings.sent3: The copyboy playfully pretended to be a superhero while running errands for the office staff.
meanings.sent4: His efficiency in completing tasks made the copyboy an indispensable part of the office team.
meanings.sent5: Every morning, the copyboy made sure the office supplies were fully stocked and ready for the day.
